intro: Cyrilla brevifolia, commonly known as the shortleaf cyrilla, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lythraceae family, which includes plants such as willows and poinsettias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of bright red, lantern-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. Cyrilla brevifolia typically grows in wetlands and along stream edges, preferring moist, sandy soils. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
